column4: I'm trying to get Ubuntu to run and delete my other os (genuine windows XP) with only a flashdrive and a shitty Toshiba Satellite A205-S5000. I've put the .iso downloaded from the Ubuntu website on a flashdrive and got my PC to try and boot from the drive, but it said I had no OS on the drive, so I then unpacked the files with WinRAR onto the drive and tried again, only getting the same error

message. I've thought about installing Ubuntu with Wubi as a partition and then manually removing XP, but I worry that that will give Ubuntu limited access to my hard drive on account of it thinking that it is a partitian.
Please don't flood; use http://paste.ubuntu.com to paste; don't use Enter as punctuation.
